to CO under visible light irradiation.The electrons on Ag-NPs are then injected to CO 2 for its reduction while holes are consumed for H 2 oxidation.The produced hydrogen radicals together with the electrons reduced CO 2 to CO, CH 3 OH and CH 4 .The production of CO as the main product was due to reverse water gas shift reaction and evidently due to difference in kinetic rates for CO 2 reduction products.Therefore, the enhanced photocatalytic activity of Ag-NPs-promoted TiO 2 NWs core-shell hetero-junction

TiO 2 NWs was found to be the most active, giving the highest CO evolution of 983 mmole-g-catal.A1 h A1 at selectivity 98.This amount of CO produced was 23 times more than the TiO 2 NWs and 109 times larger than the yield of CO produced over the pure TiO 2 .More importantly, the quantum yield was substantially enhanced for CO evolution.The LSPR excitation and synergic effect of Ag-NPs which can effectively accelerate the charge separation was proposed to be responsible for the enhancement of photocatalytic

charges.In this way, enhanced photoactivity could be achieved for visible light driven reduction of CO 2 to CO, CH 4 and CH 3 OH.The yield rates of different products are presented in Table 2. The yield of CO over Ag-NPsTiO 2 NWs was 983 mmole gcatal.A1 h A1 , a 23 times more than TiO 2 NWs and 109 times higher than TiO 2 .It is likely to see that 13 mmole g-catal.A1 h A1 of CH 3 OH was produced over Ag-NPsTiO 2 NWs but was not detected in TiO 2 and TiO 2 NWs.These revealed Ag-NPs are also favorable for CH

and efficient separation of charges over the TiO 2 NWs surface. The stability of Ag-NPs-loaded TiO 2 NWs catalyst was further investigated to evaluate the life of catalyst under UV and visible light irradiations.In order to investigate the stability of Ag-NPs-loaded TiO 2 NWs catalyst, all the experiments were repeated in cyclic runs under the identical conditions.The stability test for photocatalytic CO 2 reduction with H 2 to CO for Ag-NPs-loaded TiO 2 NWs catalyst is presented in Fig. 10(a).After each
